page.title: 20Growing Up in West Bromwich
page.content:
I live two lives; an Indian girl at home and a black girl with a white mask at home. I suffer cultural and identity crises. When I thought I was a rebellious teenager, my difficulties were really manifestations of this. Indian families' are tightly knit. This presents real problems; I am expected to conform to both white and my family's culture. In my confusion I am gradually rejecting the medieval aspects of Asian culture. Afterwards I again attempt the futile pursuit of compromise. My parents want me to succeed in white society, yet retain my Indian identity. They are asking too much of me.
Teresa Rashpal Kaur 15
